title: Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank borrows EC$2.786 million from China Eximbank to support on-lending activities
description: In Fiscal Year 2008, Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank — a bank that is majority-owned by the Government of the Commonwealth of Dominica (GOCD) — borrowed EC$2,786,102  from China Eximbank to support on-lending activities. The loan was guaranteed by the GOCD
staff_comments: 1. The 2008 annual report of the Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank identifies the ‘Republic of China’ as the lender. However, given that Dominica severed diplomatic ties with Taiwan in May 2004, the lender is almost certainly the People’s Republic of China (PRC). Reporting by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) corroborates the existence of a lending relationship between the PRC and Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank. 2. The precise financial commitment date is unknown. However, it is known that the EC$2,786,102  borrowing took place between July 1, 2007 and June 30, 2008. 3. For evidence that the lender is China Eximbank, see https://www.dropbox.com/s/jwlm7akcczpmbgr/New%20AID%20Bank%20Chairman%20outlines%20plans%20for%20the%20bank%20-%20GIS%20Dominica.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/jntz051chitv5pp/Rationale%20-%20Dominica%20AID%20Bank%20June%204%2C%202013%282%29.pdf?dl=0. 4. This China Eximbank loan is not captured in the China-Latin America Finance Database, which is co-produced by the Inter-American Dialogue and Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank borrows EC$2.786 million from China Eximbank to support on-lending activities

# Description
In Fiscal Year 2008, Dominica Agricultural Industrial and Development Bank — a bank that is majority-owned by the Government of the Commonwealth of Dominica (GOCD) — borrowed EC$2,786,102  from China Eximbank to support on-lending activities. The loan was guaranteed by the GOCD
justification: Project involves financial services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Loan for on-lending activities through a development bank, no specific environmental or energy-related activities mentioned

title: China Begins Language Training in Dominican Republic (linked to #61029)
description: On November 23rd, 2008, China officially started a Chinese language program at the Polytechnic Institute of Santo Domingo (INTEC) in the Dominican Republic. Li Junfen and volunteers from the National Chinese International Promotion Office of the Ministry of Education of China arrived in the Dominican Republic. The volunteers established language classes at the International Language Center at INTEC, and taught in the Chinese Culture School in “Chinatown.” They also provided consultation and teacher training to the Chinese School of the “Overseas Chinese Association." The students attending the language training included children of Chinese immigrants and Dominican citizens. According to the Foreign Ministry article, the volunteers opened five Chinese classes following their arrival, with a total of 60 students.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Begins Language Training in Dominican Republic (linked to #61029)

# Description
On November 23rd, 2008, China officially started a Chinese language program at the Polytechnic Institute of Santo Domingo (INTEC) in the Dominican Republic. Li Junfen and volunteers from the National Chinese International Promotion Office of the Ministry of Education of China arrived in the Dominican Republic. The volunteers established language classes at the International Language Center at INTEC, and taught in the Chinese Culture School in “Chinatown.” They also provided consultation and teacher training to the Chinese School of the “Overseas Chinese Association." The students attending the language training included children of Chinese immigrants and Dominican citizens. According to the Foreign Ministry article, the volunteers opened five Chinese classes following their arrival, with a total of 60 students.
justification: Project focuses on language education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Chinese language program, cultural education, teacher training, no energy-related components

title: Chinese government donates $100,000 to help fund de-mining efforts in Ecuador-Peru border region (linked to #35841)
description: On July 16, 2008, the Chinese Ambassador to Ecuador, on behalf of the Chinese government, handed over a 100,000 USD grant to Ecuador's Chapter of the Binational Plan for the Development of the Ecuador-Peru Border Region (Plan Binacional de Desarrollo de la Región Fronteriza Ecuador-Perú, Capítulo Ecuador), to the account No. 020877049 del CITIBANK. The grant's purpose was to contribute to humanitarian de mining efforts, involving the removal of landmines on Ecuador's border with Peru.   The grant was to be administered by the National Center for Humanitarian Demining of Ecuador (Centro Nacional de Desminado Humanitario del Ecuador, CENDESMI).   Around the same time, a similar donation was provided to Peru (see project #35841).
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

The grant's purpose was to contribute to humanitarian de mining efforts, involving the removal of landmines on Ecuador's border with Peru.   The grant was to be administered by the National Center for Humanitarian Demining of Ecuador (Centro Nacional de Desminado Humanitario del Ecuador, CENDESMI).   Around the same time, a similar donation was provided to Peru (see project #35841).
justification: Humanitarian de-mining project with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Humanitarian de-mining efforts, social development focus, no energy or industrial components

title: Chinese government grants breast cancer prevention equipment worth USD 294,005
description: On February 18 and April 15, 2008, the Chinese Government signed an exchange of letters committing to donate breast cancer prevention equipment to several health institutions in Ecuador. According to "La Cooperación Bilateral Ecuador-China," the equipment was worth USD 294,005.01.   More specifically, one x-ray machine (equipo de Rayos X) that went to the Ambato Teaching Hospital in Tungurahua, one x-ray machine went to the Alfonso Oramas González Health Center in Guayas, and one mammogram machine to the Martha de Roldos Health Center in Guayas. The equipment arrived in Guayaquil January 10, 2009, and the official handover took place on February 13, 2009.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Description
On February 18 and April 15, 2008, the Chinese Government signed an exchange of letters committing to donate breast cancer prevention equipment to several health institutions in Ecuador. According to "La Cooperación Bilateral Ecuador-China," the equipment was worth USD 294,005.01.   More specifically, one x-ray machine (equipo de Rayos X) that went to the Ambato Teaching Hospital in Tungurahua, one x-ray machine went to the Alfonso Oramas González Health Center in Guayas, and one mammogram machine to the Martha de Roldos Health Center in Guayas. The equipment arrived in Guayaquil January 10, 2009, and the official handover took place on February 13, 2009.
justification: Project involves donation of medical equipment for healthcare purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Breast cancer prevention equipment, x-ray machines, mammogram machine, health institutions

title: China donates USD 8,099,142.38 to World Vision International for Tiquizambi Area Development Program
description: In April 2008, China began sponsoring the Tiquizambi Area Development Program (Programa de Desarrollo de Area Tiquizambi) through World Vision International. The project is supposed to end in September 2023. The total project cost is USD 8,099,142.38. Of that, USD 525,889.94 was disbursed in 2021.

# Description
In April 2008, China began sponsoring the Tiquizambi Area Development Program (Programa de Desarrollo de Area Tiquizambi) through World Vision International. The project is supposed to end in September 2023. The total project cost is USD 8,099,142.38. Of that, USD 525,889.94 was disbursed in 2021.

evidence: Development program through World Vision International, no energy or industrial components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides grant worth EGP 55,000 provision of computers and fax machines to Egypt's Ministry of Defense Language Institute
description: On November 5, 2008, according to Egyptian Ministry of Defense and Military Production Resolution No. 132 of 2008, the Government Egypt accepted a grant of eight computers and two fax machines worth EGP 55,000 pounds from the Chinese Government for the Ministry of Defense Language Institute (also known as Languages ​​Armed Forces Institute or معهد لغات القوات المسلحة). The specific Chinese Government institution that donated the materials is unknown.

title: CRBC grants two buses to Equatorial Guinea
description: On September 26, 2008, the China Road and Bridge Corporation in Equatorial Guinea donated two large buses. The Secretary General of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea Lucas Nguema Esono Mbang was present at the handover ceremony. The value of the vehicles is unknown.
